text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum now fettuccine
alfredo can easily turn out thick and
pasty instead of rich and smooth and
today i'm going to share with you a
foolproof method in making a super
wonderful velvety alfredo sauce that's
perfect for any type of pasta
[Music]
although alfredo sauce can go with a
wide variety of different shapes of
pasta today I'm using a classic I think
here in the United States and that is
fettuccine so I have 3/4 of a pound of
fettuccine and I'm going to boil this in
a pot of heavily salted water so you
want to make sure you have a good amount
of water and you want to use a decent
quantity of salt so that the salt
actually flavors the pasta and in the
end your pasta dish will be that much
more enjoyable so pasta in and depending
on the brand you buy the type of pasta
you're making this will take anywhere
from 8 to 10 minutes now give it a good
stir once it goes in the water and while
the pasta is boiling I'm gonna make the
alfredo sauce so this is a really super
simple recipe and it's actually I'm
gonna say it's an adaptation of the
original now it is said that the
original alfredo sauce was created in
Italy and it was two things it is butter
and Parmesan and that's it but I'll say
that alfredo sauce has really picked up
popularity in the United States it's not
something you really see in Italy and
it's typically creamier than the
original version so it usually has cream
in it there are some variations that
include egg yolks and garlic and so
today I'm making kind of a hybrid
version but a version that I think is
very popular here in the United States
so I have a wide skillet here and I'm
going to add four tablespoons of
unsalted butter now since there are very
few ingredients in an alfredo sauce you
want to make sure that you're using good
quality ingredients so if you can find a
European style butter I would use that
here something that has really great
flavor to it so I'm going to melt that
over medium heat and to the butter I'm
going to add a clove of garlic that's
been finely minced now this again is an
ingredient that has been added to the
original recipe but again I think it's
what people typically think of when they
have an alfredo sauce it's something
that is garlicky but also really
super creamy and rich so melt the butter
allow the garlic to really infuse the
butter with its flavor you don't want to
pick up any color here so make sure
you're on a nice low heat a nice
moderate heat and you're just cooking
the garlic until it smells nice and
sweet you don't want anything that's
brown or burnt because that will give
off kind of an acrid flavor to it so the
garlic here is really nice and fragrant
and our butter is bubbling up and this
is the time now where I want to add a
cup of heavy cream now like I said
before this wasn't included in the
original version but many chefs have
adopted the use of heavy cream and
Alfredo for a few reasons
one it helps once it gets kind of mixed
in with the butter here and we're gonna
bubble this down and simmer it and
reduce it down to something really nice
it helps the sauce to keep nice and
cohesive if you use just butter and
cheese sometimes what happens is with a
higher temperature it actually splits
and separates and you get something
that's pretty greasy in the end but this
cream once it cooks down and this will
take about five to six minutes we'll
give you something that's really velvety
and cohesive all right so it's been a
few minutes our sauce has reduced down
it's nice and velvety there's almost a
little bit of a trail that is left
behind in the pan if you could see this
and that's when you know it's ready so
I'm gonna pull it off the heat let me
just put it on a hot pad and now I'm
gonna add the cheese now you want to add
the cheese and this is just finely
grated Parmesan cheese off the heat
because often times what will happen if
you add this on direct heat the cheese
will actually separate there's not a lot
of moisture in Parmesan cheese because
it's an aged cheese so it has a tendency
to break if it's exposed to high heat so
stir this in I'm gonna fish out my
fettuccine which is really nicely cooked
it's a little el Dante a little bit of a
bite to it which is what you want and
now give this a stir a gentle stir off
the heat look at how rich and creamy
this is it smells so wonderful you can
season it up with a little bit of salt
if you liked pepper you could add that
as well but I think I'm gonna leave the
pepper out if you want it a little bit
of spice I think adding a little bit of
red pepper flakes would be really
fantastic here and if you wanted to take
this to the next level you could even
grate some lemon zest right into this
while it's still warm and it will be
really nice and lemony but also rich and
delicious
now this can be served up with so many
different things or you could leave it
just by itself how about some grilled
chicken or some sauteed shrimp that
would be really fantastic with this
fettuccine but there's no excuse you
don't have to go out to a restaurant to
get this amazing fettuccine alfredo you
can make it at home in less than ten
minutes to be quite honest give it a
little bit of a sprinkling of extra
cheese and there you go a kitchen
conundrum solved in under ten minutes
now as always if you have any kitchen
